data.title: Improved GWT full-screen support.
data.body:
Improved support for the full-screen Web API by adding support for Internet Explorer 11, Edge and any other browsers implementing the non-prefixed version of the standard.

Furthermore, made sure supportsDisplayModeChange() stops pretending that all browsers can go full-screen, and removed an unused variable.

data.body:
It too slowly since you support APK expansion.
I load ~100 files in one batch for ~4s with Gdx.files.external  
~240s with internal (normal)
~350s with internal (apk expansion obb)

PS: android only

data.title: Fix FloatTextureData issue
data.body: Fixes #3615

data.title: FloatFrameBuffer always throws GDXRuntimeException on instantiation
data.body:
To reproduce, put this anywhere in a LWJGL project:
    `FloatFrameBuffer floatFrameBuffer = new FloatFrameBuffer(128, 128, false);`

This is caused by `FloatTextureData.consumeCustomData()` checking for the existence of the extension "texture_float" instead of the actual extension names "GL_ARB_texture_float" or "OES_texture_float" (depending on platform).

I think this is because LWJGLGraphics once upon a time did not parse the extensions string into an array and check for exact matches. Instead, it simply used `.contains()` on the extensions string as a whole.

data.title: btDbvtNode#getChilds() should return two btDbvtNodes
data.body:
In the Bullet wrapper, [btDbvtNode#getChilds()](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/extensions/gdx-bullet/jni/swig-src/collision/com/badlogic/gdx/physics/bullet/collision/btDbvtNode.java#L91-L94) is supposed to return an array of two btDbvtNodes, which are child nodes in the binary Dynamic bounding volume tree (Dbvt).
The array of child nodes (called childs) can be accessed through the anonymous union nested in the btDbvtNode struct:
http://bulletphysics.org/Bullet/BulletFull/btDbvt_8h_source.html#l00177

The wrapper could be extended with the methods:
`btDbvtNode btDbvtNode#getChild(int index);` and/or
`btDbvtNode btDbvtNode#getChild0();`, `btDbvtNode btDbvtNode#getChild1();`

To test the functionality, any Bullet test program which contains a btDbvtBroadphase and some collision objects can likely be used:
`boolean working = broadphase.getSet0().getRoot().getChild0() != null || broadphase.getSet0().getRoot().getChild1() != null;`

data.title: Add following methods to Json.java: fromJson(Object, String), readObject(Object, Class, JsonValue)
data.body: According to my experience it is very useful to have the possibility to load from Json file the fields of the existing object. For example one can use to as an initialized inside constructor. Actually we are using such method for about 2 years and can say that is virtually the only way Json deserializer is used now in our projects. Could be useful for others.

data.title: Can't get JsonValue from String returned by JsonValue.toString()
data.body: I need to parse JsonValue to String and then parse this String back to JsonValue. JsonReader fails to parse String returned by JsonValue.toString() because of appended name. One way I found so far is to use awkward String manipulations but there clearly should be an easier way.

data.title: Methods in btDbvt#ICollide are supposed to be callbacks
data.body:
The [methods in btDbvt#ICollide](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/extensions/gdx-bullet/jni/swig-src/collision/com/badlogic/gdx/physics/bullet/collision/btDbvt.java#L386-L404) are supposed to be callbacks.

ICollide struct definition:
http://bulletphysics.org/Bullet/BulletFull/btDbvt_8h_source.html#l00227

Example usage for occlusion culling in C++:
https://github.com/kripken/bullet/blob/master/Extras/CDTestFramework/BulletSAPCompleteBoxPruningTest.cpp#L873-L907

The user implementation/extension of ICollide is supposed to be passed to btDbvt#collideOCL, which should call back its methods according to:
http://bulletphysics.org/Bullet/BulletFull/btDbvt_8h_source.html#l01131
The parameter DBVT_IPOLICY is defined as 'ICollide& policy' at line 90.
http://bulletphysics.org/Bullet/BulletFull/btDbvt_8h_source.html#l00090

Test program which will print "SUCCESS!" repeatedly if the callback works. 
https://gist.github.com/jsjolund/f9eab4e279c6badc2cee
To run it, add it to the Bullet test program suite. Obviously it is not meant to be a permanent addition since it does nothing useful except test if the callback works.

data.title: Added convenience methods to get the center X and Y of a Sprite
data.body: I would also like to add convenience methods to get the right and top positions of a Sprite, similar to what Actor already has.

data.title: Fix #3604 - missing enter after stopping exit event
data.body:
The same event object is being used for `enter` and `exit` in `fireEnterAndExit()`. If the user decides to `stop()` the `exit` event, then `enter` will be stopped as well.

Fix: fire `enter` with a fresh event object.

data.title: scene2d - enter event is missing after stopping exit event
data.body:
The same event object is being used for `enter` and `exit` in `fireEnterAndExit()`. If the user decides to `stop()` the `exit` event, then `enter` will be stopped as well.

The input event should be reset before firing `enter`.

data.title: Add LwjglApplicationConfiguration.preferencesFileType
data.body: Add LwjglApplicationConfiguration.preferencesFileType to allow absolute preference path according to (#3602).

data.title: Optional absolute path to preferences directory
data.body:
Some game portals (like G-Cluster) manage separate directories for game saves for every game / player. They supply the absolute path to the game via their SDK. The problem is that such directory can be outside the user folder. Like "C:\saves...".

Unfortunately LwjglApplicationcreates an instance of LwjglPreferences using FileType.External. It would be nice to have a config option to supply the desired filetype (either FileType.External, or FileType.Absolute). Otherwise one has to override getPreferences method of LwjglApplication, which is not that nice.

data.title: Only call free() on malloc()'d strings.
data.body:
Bug report (and actually the bug fix description too):
http://steamcommunity.com/app/371430/discussions/1/490121928343760774/

Caused by calling free() on results of getCString() which hasn't always been allocated with malloc().

I was able to reproduce the crash, and test the fix with Space Grunts.

data.title: Bugfix for GdxSetupUI on Linux when needing a SDK update
data.body:
This fixes a bug with the current Setup UI on Linux:

```
java.io.IOException: Cannot run program ""/home/theboss/Software/Android-SDK/tools/android": error=2, Datei oder Verzeichnis nicht gefunden
    at java.lang.ProcessBuilder.start(ProcessBuilder.java:1048)
    at java.lang.Runtime.exec(Runtime.java:620)
    at java.lang.Runtime.exec(Runtime.java:450)
    at java.lang.Runtime.exec(Runtime.java:347)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.setup.GdxSetupUI.generate(Unknown Source)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.setup.GdxSetupUI$UI$4.actionPerformed(Unknown Source)
```

The problem comes from manipulating file names directly instead of using the java.io.File API.
I didn't change the Windows branch because I'm not able to test it at the moment.

data.title: Performance regression in VertexBufferObjectWithVAO
data.body:
For now I just want to document this, as I don't have an idea yet how to resolve this in a nice way, and without breaking the VertexData interface.

Issue caused by  #3050, #3051

When using VertexBufferObjectWithVAO / GL30, vertex buffer and vertex attributes bindings are redone each VertexBufferObjectWithVAO.bind() call. I'm not sure about the actual performance hit on current desktop GPUs, but it causes a lot of unnecessary GL calls.

data.title: Make Color Serializable
data.body: I know you guys aren't Java-serializations fans, but this is useful to others (that is me :smile:) implementing games saves with the jdk's sole support. Color has the advantage of having a compact serialized form.

data.title: Strange performance using TextField
Fix iOS touch mapping
data.body:
iOS backend did not map touch coordinates to libGDX correctly. libGDX's GL View is stretched over whole screen, but libGDX draws only on a subset of that, because it excludes status bar, if present. Touch mapping was however completely oblivious to this fact - this worked well when the status bar was not visible, but was inaccurate when the status bar was indeed visible.

This PR rewrites rotation/resize handling and touch coordinate mapping to explicitly handle mentioned problems.

This is somewhat related to issues:
#2105 - although this seems to be the opposite issue, it is not present after this PR
#3278 - does not fix this, but allows it to be fixed in user code by overriding `IOSApplication.getBounds` and providing correct bounds

Note that I am not an iOS expert, but I have tested it and it works.

data.title: Fix iOS touch mapping
data.body:
iOS backend did not map touch coordinates to libGDX correctly. libGDX's GL View is stretched over whole screen, but libGDX draws only on a subset of that, because it excludes status bar, if present. Touch mapping was however completely oblivious to this fact - this worked well when the status bar was not visible, but was inaccurate when the status bar was indeed visible.

This PR rewrites rotation/resize handling and touch coordinate mapping to explicitly handle mentioned problems. It also removes some unused code and cleans up existing code, fixing some obsolete TODOs.

This is somewhat related to issues:
#2105 - although this seems to be the opposite issue, it is not present after this PR
#3278 - does not fix this, but allows it to be fixed in user code by overriding `IOSApplication.getBounds` and providing correct bounds

Note that I am not an iOS expert, but I have tested it and it works.
